plotGUI module¶

platform

Unix, Windows

synopsis

This module contains generated code from QtDesigner and custom code for the GUI containing the live plot.

moduleauthor

Michael Eller <mbe9a@virginia.edu>

plotGUI.stop = 0¶

This global member is used to create a soft stop signal for a plotGUI.Ui_Dialog object

plotGUI.initial_hash = 0¶

initial_hash is set on the creation of a plotGUI.Ui_Dialog object. Hashing is used to detect a change in the settings files. The program will periodically hash the settings files and compare with initial_hash. If a change has been detected, plotGUI.Ui_dialog.update_plot() will be called.

class plotGUI.MyThread(callback1, callback2)[source]¶

Bases: PyQt5.QtCore.QThread

This is a simple class to implement a QThread object and specify its run() method.

__init__(callback1, callback2)[source]¶

Initialize the QThread and set the callback stubs.

Parameters

  • callback1 – Callback function for the thread to execute within dataSendLoop(). T his callback must send a new data point to the plot.

  • callback2 – Callback function triggered in dataSendLoop() and is responsible for triggering update_plot().

run()[source]¶

This overrides the parent run() method. Thread will run the infinite loop in dataSendLoop().

class plotGUI.Ui_Dialog[source]¶

Bases: object

The graphical structure of this Ui_Dialog was generated by QtDesigner. The window contains a few buttons and an embedded matplotlib animation.

setupUi(Dialog)[source]¶

This function initializes the window by altering the Dialog object passed (by reference) to it.

Parameters

Dialog – This must be of type PyQt5.QtWidgets.QDialog.

retranslateUi(Dialog)[source]¶

This function translates the GUI objects of this class to the passed Dialog objcect, then sets the text of the various objects in the window.

Parameters

Dialog – This must be of type PyQt5.QtWidgets.QDialog.

addData_callbackFunc(value)[source]¶

This function adds the most recent ADC value to the buffer in the animation object.

Parameters

value – number from the serial port. This is ‘emitted’ from mySrc in dataSendLoot().

update_plot(value)[source]¶

This function calls a series of functions within the animation object to update the figure axes and filtering.

Parameters

value – the format of this function requires value to be present. It is unused in this function.

close()[source]¶

This function creates a controlled and soft close. The figure and serial must be closed before the window is allowed to close.

save_image(Dialog)[source]¶

Saves the current plot canvas as an image file. It will open a save dialog in order to get the desired file path from the user.

Parameters

Dialog – The same PyQt5.QtWidgets.QDialog object passed to the PlotGUI.Ui_Dialog.

save_csv(Dialog)[source]¶

This function saves all recorded data in a simple format. Opens a save file dialog to get the desired file path from the user.

Parameters

Dialog – The same PyQt5.QtWidgets.QDialog object passed to the PlotGUI.Ui_Dialog.

class plotGUI.Communicate[source]¶

Bases: PyQt5.QtCore.QObject

In order to cleanly send data throughout the different processes within the GUI, a thread-safe mechanism must be used. This is an extension of a built-in pyqt signal. It can be connected to a slot (function) that will trigger when the signal emits a value.

data_signal¶
plotGUI.dataSendLoop(addData_callbackFunc, update_plot)[source]¶

This is the infinite loop executed by a separate thread. Based on the sample rate set by the user, it will periodically poll a new value over the serial port and send it to the animation through a signal-slot mechanism. This function is also responsible for re-hashing the settings files and checking for necessary updates to the plot axes and filtering. If a change is detected, it will trigger the update_plot() function.

Parameters

  • addData_callbackFunc – slot function for adding data to the plot.

  • update_plot – slot function for updating the plot filtering and axes.

plotGUI.get_interval()[source]¶

This is a helper function to calculate the time between samples. It reads the sample rate value from the settings file and takes the inverse.

Returns

the interval in seconds.

plotGUI.check_for_change()[source]¶

If a change was detected return True. If no change, return False.

Returns

bool

plotGUI.get_hash()[source]¶

This function uses hashlib to generate an md5 hash of the settings file.

Returns

the hash of the settings file
